noun.description: Chiefly in Semitic languages: a syllable, particle, etc., suffixed as a formative element.

adjective.description: Chiefly in Semitic languages: (of a syllable, particle, etc.) suffixed as a formative element.

origin: Late 18th century. From post-classical Latin afformativus from classical Latin af-, variant of ad- + post-classical Latin formativus.
